results.title: New York lightboard
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Paper cutouts were used for Norman McLaren’s single-frame animation of linear symbols in this Canadian tourism publicity clip. Projected in Times Square, New York, the large signboard was made up of thousands of light bulbs activated by the film images.

results.title: New year sacrifice = Zhu fu [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Sang Hu and Beijing Film Studio
results.brief_description: A tragic story that highlights the humiliations and hardships endured by women in traditional Chinese society, focusing on the life of a twice widowed, middle-aged village woman. Her last hopes of happiness are shattered by the news of the death her son. Cast includes Yang Bai and Wei Heling. In Mandarin with English subtitles. Based on the original work by the famous writer Lu Xun.

results.title: New worlds for old
results.creator_credit: Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A survey of the progress being made in Papua and New Guinea, showing new industries, new roads and means of transport, the introduction of sheep, cattle and goats, and the way in which the natives are being encouraged to cooperate in these activities.

results.title: New ways with wool
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Les Davidson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The production of many new types of synthetic fibres is a threat to the future of the Australian wool industry - the chemist is producing new materials more closely resembling the characteristics of wool. This film, showing how the wool industry is meeting this challenge, is an account of the work being done at various research centres throughout the Commonwealth, investigating and improving the production, processing, and use of wool.

results.title: New Wave: French Connection
results.brief_description:
A documentary account of a Punk/New Wave festival held in the Fourvieres roman theatre of Lyons in the summer of 1978. Fourvieres made its mark in the history of entertainement as a place where Christians were thrown to the lions. In 1978 only great expectations are shattered as ‘Marie et les garcons’ are booed off the stage. The concert showcases French exponents of the New Wave movement, such as Telephone, Bijou, Starshooters as well as Heavy Metal band Ganafoul and reggae outfit Cimarons, all working hard to prove that there is a world of peaceful harmony outside Disco. The documentary ends with that also familiar concert ritual: an ocean of empty beer cans being swept away.
Cast: Interviews by Jean-Francois Bizot.

results.title: New uses for Seaweed
results.brief_description: A brief account of the uses to which alginates, which are obtained from seaweed, are being put - from foodstuffs to toothpaste. A fine synthetic fibre, spun from the jelly is used in the manufacture of light-weight woollen materials.

results.title: New town
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A cartoon film explaining the need for town planning to avoid a repetition of past mistakes. Diagrams illustrate how towns have grown without provision being made for proper transport, for the separation of industrial and residential areas and the provision of playgrounds and conveniently situated shopping centres.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joy Batchelor, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films

results.title: New tools for learning
results.creator_credit: Bernard Berelson and Audio-Visual Center of University of Chicago
results.brief_description: Shows how the film, together with a wide range of other materials, can bring richness and greater vitality to teaching. Effective methods of classroom use of films are demonstrated through scenes showing pupils and teachers at work in school situation, at junior and senior high school and also university level. The importance of the use of a wide range of instructional materials in the tremendous task of education is stressed.
